H0.text: Sunset is the time of day during which the highest temperatures are most often recorded.

H1.text: Afternoon is the time of day during which the highest temperatures are most often recorded.

H2.text: Sunrise is the time of day during which the highest temperatures are most often recorded.

H3.text: Night is the time of day during which the highest temperatures are most often recorded.

A4.text: Peak daily temperature generally occurs after noon, as air keeps absorbing net heat for a period of time from morning through noon and some time thereafter.
